result.markdown:
--- title: "Effect size and power" --- ## Content - Measures of effect size - Power calculations - Interplay between sample size, effect and power ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - correctly report effect size for common statistics in analysis of variance models - deduce the sample size necessary to replicate a study at a given power - explain the interplay between sample size, power and effect size. ## Readings - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 7](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/07-power_effect.html) of the course notes - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 8](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/08-reproducibility_crisis.html) of the course notes - {{< fa book-open-reader >}} [Effect size and power example](/example/effectsizepower.html) ## Complementary readings - {{< fa book >}} Chapters 3 (section *Power of the $F$ Test*) and 4 (section *Measures of Effects*) of @Maxwell.Delaney.Kelley:2017. - {{< fa file >}} @Lakens:2013 - {{< fa file >}} @Steiger:2004 - {{< fa file >}} @Kelley/Preacher:2012 ## Slides
